subject: Hannah Storm: You're Never Too Old To Rock 'N' Roll
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 



       April 30, 
      2007



Hi, 
      everybody,
 
I hope you all had a 
      great weekend. I had a lot of fun catching "The Killers" in concert 
      Saturday night at Madison Square Garden. They were absolutely fantastic, 
      great rock and roll with really high energy and they did not stop for an 
      hour and a half. We were dancing like crazy. When I told Dave what I did 
      over the weekend he started laughing and didn't think it was a typical 
      concert for a suburban mother of three. But, I had to remind Dave 
      that back in the day I was a rock and roll DJ in Texas and I have not lost 
      my cool factor. He got a kick out of it.
 
It sure was great 
      to see Tony Snow this morning. The White 
      House press secretary recently took time off to fight 
      a recurrence of cancer. He 
      still faces chemotherapy but was back at work with a positive message for 
      those who also suffer from the 
      disease. 
 
Tony and Harry also 
      chatted about George Tenet's 
      stunning "60 
      Minutes" 
      interview with Scott Pelley. You can see that 
      interview on CBSNews.com. And, 
      Tenet, the former director of the CIA, will be on 
      The Early 
      Show tomorrow to 
      discuss his new book, "At the Center of the Storm."
 
Also today, a couple of 
      pop culture notes, Mark Phillips had 
      the latest from London on the Paul McCartney/Heather Mills split, including the reports that Mills will 
      take another run at reality TV by appearing on the British version 
      of "Big Brother." Julie joked that maybe she'll appear on 
      the American version! 
 
People magazine's Jess 
      Cagle gave us the low down on all of the great summer 
      movies coming up. One of the most anticipated 
      is "Spider-Man 3" which I can tell you is unbelievable. It 
      apparently is the most expensive movie ever
made and it has the special effects to prove it. I loved 
      it. Spider-Man was my favorite super hero growing up, 
      I watched all of the cartoons and boy has he come a long way! 
      This week we'll 
      chat with the stars of "Spider-Man 3" -- Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst and Bryce Dallas 
      Howard. 
 
It started off cold and 
      rainy in New York but it is now warm and sunny so I am off to exercise and enjoy some fresh air. I hope you guys have 
      a fantastic day and I'll see you tomorrow at 7a.m.!
 
Take 
      Care,
 
      


Hannah 
      Storm
EarlyShow@cbs.com
